net.proteusframework.core.metric

Class MonitorDeviceMetric

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.metric.DeviceMetric
      • net.proteusframework.core.metric.DpiDeviceMetric
        • net.proteusframework.core.metric.MonitorDeviceMetric

  • public class MonitorDeviceMetric
extends DpiDeviceMetric
    The MonitorDeviceMetric models a device whose dimensions are defined by pixels.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MonitorDeviceMetric(int width, int height, double dpi)
      Construct a new MonitorDeviceMetric with the given pixel dimensions and DPI for both the width and height.
      MonitorDeviceMetric(int width, int height, double dpiWidth, double dpiHeight)
      Construct a new MonitorDeviceMetric with the given pixel dimensions and DPI values for the width and height.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Dimension getNativeSize()
      Get the native dimensions of the device.
      Metric nativeMetricHeight(Metric metric)
      Convert the given Metric to the Device's native Metric object.
      Metric nativeMetricWidth(Metric metric)
      Convert the given Metric to the Device's native Metric object.
      void setNativeSize(int width, int height)
      Change the dimensions of the device using the given pixel dimensions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonitorDeviceMetric

        public MonitorDeviceMetric(int width,
                   int height,
                   double dpi)
        Construct a new MonitorDeviceMetric with the given pixel dimensions and DPI for both the width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - The width in pixels
        height - The height in pixels
        dpi - The DPI
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if dpi<=0 or if the width or height are less than or equal to zero.

      • MonitorDeviceMetric

        public MonitorDeviceMetric(int width,
                   int height,
                   double dpiWidth,
                   double dpiHeight)
        Construct a new MonitorDeviceMetric with the given pixel dimensions and DPI values for the width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - The width in pixels
        height - The height in pixels
        dpiWidth - The DPI for the width
        dpiHeight - The DPI for the height
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either DPI<=0 or if the width or height are less than or equal to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • getNativeSize

        public Dimension getNativeSize()
        Description copied from class: DeviceMetric
        Get the native dimensions of the device. The Metric objects will be in the native unit.
        Specified by:
        getNativeSize in class DeviceMetric
        Returns:
        The dimensions of the device

      • nativeMetricHeight

        public Metric nativeMetricHeight(Metric metric)
        Description copied from class: DeviceMetric
        Convert the given Metric to the Device's native Metric object. PercentMetric objects will be relative to the device size. The given metric is assumed to be a height.
        Specified by:
        nativeMetricHeight in class DeviceMetric
        Parameters:
        metric - The Metric to convert
        Returns:
        The Device's native Metric equivalent

      • nativeMetricWidth

        public Metric nativeMetricWidth(Metric metric)
        Description copied from class: DeviceMetric
        Convert the given Metric to the Device's native Metric object. PercentMetric objects will be relative to the device size. The given metric is assumed to be a width.
        Specified by:
        nativeMetricWidth in class DeviceMetric
        Parameters:
        metric - The Metric to convert
        Returns:
        The Device's native Metric equivalent

      • setNativeSize

        public void setNativeSize(int width,
                 int height)
        Change the dimensions of the device using the given pixel dimensions.
        Parameters:
        width - The width in pixels
        height - The height in pixels
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the width or height are less than or equal to zero
